summary: This document is an email chain from October 2021 between an FBI Special Agent and a US Attorney's Office contractor discussing the transfer of email tips from the SDNY regarding the Maxwell and Epstein hotlines. The emails focus on obtaining updated tracking spreadsheets for tipline leads to fulfill discovery obligations (3500 production).

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: FBI Special Agent from the New York Field Office, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit, corresponding with a US Attorney's Office contractor about compiling and transferring email tips and tracking spreadsheets related to the Maxwell and Epstein hotlines.

persons.name: Contractor
persons.context: Contractor for the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) requesting and coordinating the transfer of email tips and tracking spreadsheets for the Maxwell and Epstein hotlines from the FBI for AUSA review and 3500 production.

connections.description: Working together to compile and transfer email tips and tracking spreadsheets from the FBI to the US Attorney's Office related to the Maxwell and Epstein investigations.

events.title: Email tips uploaded for review
events.description: An FBI Special Agent informs a US Attorney's Office contractor that they have uploaded a batch of email tips sent over from the SDNY regarding the Maxwell and Epstein hotlines for AUSA review.

events.title: Coordination for 3500 production
events.description: A series of emails between a US Attorney's Office contractor and an FBI Special Agent coordinating the transfer of updated tracking spreadsheets for the Maxwell and Epstein tiplines/hotlines to ensure proper discovery production (3500).

keyFacts: The document reveals ongoing investigative coordination between the FBI and the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding the Maxwell and Epstein cases as of October 2021.
The emails discuss the need for 'updated copies of the tracking spreadsheets for the tipline/hotlines for Maxwell and Epstein,' indicating active tip collection and management.

The purpose of obtaining the spreadsheets is explicitly tied to legal discovery obligations ('to make sure we have what we need to produce in 3500'), referring to Rule 3500 material (Jencks Act) for trial.
The FBI Special Agent is identified as being part of the 'Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking' unit at the New York Field Office.
The correspondence shows a batch of 'email tips sent over from SDNY' was compiled and uploaded for review by Assistant US Attorneys (AUSAs).
